snippet: Tenants in city-subsidized developments would not be allowed to oppose new unions.
abstract: New York City Council members Annabel Palma and Ritchie Torres, backed by powerful labor allies, will introduce bill that would bar retail tenants in developments that receive city subsidies from opposing efforts to unionize their workers.
lead_paragraph: Tenants in city-subsidized developments would not be allowed to oppose new unions.

headline.main: Bill Would Ease Way for Unions at Some Retail Stores in New York City
headline.print_headline: Bill Would Ease Way for Unions at Some Retail Stores
